sentence.Network_en: ' scientists won't be replaced, " he claims, " but they will be augmented. "
sentence.Network_cn: 他宣称: “ 科学家不会被取代;相反, 他们会被拓展. ”

sentence.Network_en: The impact of the report was augmented by its timing.
sentence.Network_cn: 由于发表的时间选得好,这篇报导的影响更大了.

sentence.Network_en: Pertaining to a process or system that can be augmented.
sentence.Network_cn: 用于修饰或说明一个能够扩大、增加新功能的进程或系统.

entry.def: To augment something means to make it larger, stronger, or more effective by adding something to it.

example.ex: While searching for a way to augment the family income, she began making dolls.
example.tran: 为了想法子增加家庭收入，她开始制作洋娃娃。

means.word_mean: 1. added to or made greater in amount or number or strength;

auth_sentence.content: Halser augmented exceptional natural reflexes with hours of practicing his draw.
auth_sentence.res_content: Halser augmented exceptional natural reflexes with hours of practicing his draw.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Halser augmented exceptional natural reflexes with hours of practicing his draw.

Sentence.sentence: My colleagues and I are studying something called augmented reality (a field of computer research dealing with the combination of real-world and virtual reality)," said Christopher Dede, professor in learning technologies at Harvard University, "Alien Contact," for example, is an exercise developed for middle-school students who use hand-held devices that can determine their location.
